Definition of aviator noun from the Oxford Advanced Learner's Dictionary

aviator

noun
ˈeɪvieɪtə(r)
 
; ˈeɪvieɪtər
 
(old-fashioned)
 
a person who flies an aircraft
One of Australia's pioneering women aviators learnt to fly in the 1930s.an intrepid aviator
